case.name: Shang v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs [2006] FCA 1453 (8 November 2006)

citation.tocase: Gerhard v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2003] FCA 495
citation.text: 23 It can be seen that if the Minister is satisfied that the visa holder has not complied with condition 8202 the Minister must cancel the visa holder's visa. It was contended, because of the provisions of condition 8202, that a visa holder could only comply with that condition if the visa holder complied with both paragraphs (2) and (3) of condition 8202: Gerhard v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2003] FCA 495 ; Tian v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2004] FCAFC 238.

citation.tocase: Tian v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2004] FCAFC 238
citation.text: 23 It can be seen that if the Minister is satisfied that the visa holder has not complied with condition 8202 the Minister must cancel the visa holder's visa. It was contended, because of the provisions of condition 8202, that a visa holder could only comply with that condition if the visa holder complied with both paragraphs (2) and (3) of condition 8202: Gerhard v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2003] FCA 495 ; Tian v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2004] FCAFC 238.
